item.name: Echinacea
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 Fort save vs disease for 1 hour

item.name: Borage
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 Fort save vs poison for 1 hour

item.name: Juniper
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 Fort save vs poison for 1 hour

item.name: Aconite (Wolfsbane)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 Fort saves vs animal poison/allows Fort save vs lycanthropy (DC20) if taken within 1 hour of the attack

item.name: Betony
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 Fort saves vs disease for 1 hour

item.name: Vervain
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 level to any turning or rebuke attempt for 1 hour

item.name: Acacia
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 to Will saves for 1 hour

item.name: Fools Weed
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 Will save vs fear and rage spells/effects

item.name: Rowan
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  +1 Will save vs mind effecting spells for 1 hour

item.name: Belladonna
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Allows Fort save vs lycanthropy (DC18) if taken within an hour of attack – Inflicts 1d8+2 damage

item.name: Belladonna
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Also known as deadly nightshade, this plant, with its distinctive greenish-purple leaves and dull black berries, has served as a cosmetic and medicine for longer than memory despite its toxicity. It can also induce vivid but usually unpleasant hallucinations, particularly ones dealing with flight. Herbalists and others trained to use it safely believe it has numerous applications, including pain relief.

item.name: Blight Tonic
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Blight tonic increases the potency of a creature's disease attack transmitted by physical contact, such as a dire rat's filth fever. The next time a creature must save against the drinker's disease save DC, the DC for the initial infection increases by +2. The tonic lasts for 10 minutes or until the next time a creature must save against the drinker's disease DC, whichever comes first.

item.name: Sweetspire
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Counters the effects of frostbite

item.name: Wormwood
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Expels internal parasites but causes nausea (-1 to all actions) and 1d3 subdual damage

item.name: Holly
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Fights fevers and common illness

item.name: Firesnap
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Gain 1 temporary HP for 2d6 rounds

item.name: Basil
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Gain an immediate Fort save vs poison (if currently poisoned)

item.name: Dittany
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Gain an immediate Fort save vs poison (if currently poisoned)/immediately recover 1d3 subdual damage

item.name: Caranator
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Gain and immediate save vs charm or enchantment spell (if currently under a spell)

item.name: Barley
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Immediately recover 1pt of subdual damage

item.name: Amaranth
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Immediately stops bleeding (hp loss) when applied to a wound

item.name: Yarrow
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Immediately stops bleeding (HP loss) when applied to a wound

item.name: Sukake
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Narcotic (DC13) -1 Intelligence and Wisdom/+1 Strength and Constitution for 1 hour (addictive)

item.name: Black Lotus
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Narcotic (DC18) -2 Intelligence and Wisdom/+2 Strength and Constitution for 1 hour (highly addictive)

item.name: Euphorbia
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Poison (DC12) drains 1d3 strength for 1d4 rounds

item.name: Larkspur
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Poison (DC14) causes nausea 1d4 hours/-1 to all actions

item.name: Bryony
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Poison (DC14) drains 1d4 strength and 1d2 constitution for 1d4 rounds

item.name: Hemlock
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Poison (DC15) renders its victim unconscious for 1d4 rounds

item.name: Mugwort
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Protects unborn children from harmful enchantments/spirits

item.name: Mandrake
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Root creates poison (DC17) renders its victim unconscious for 1d8 rounds/Fruit gives an immediate Fort save vs Poison at +1

item.name: Hawthorn
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): See invisible creatures for 1 round

item.name: Cloth of Gold
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Speak with animals for 1d4 rounds

item.name: Black Fester
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): This black paste is often applied on orc weapons before going on raids to stymie an enemy's healing magic. Like a poison, black fester stays on a weapon until the first time it strikes an opponent. It remains in the target's body for 1 hour. A creature exposed to black fester resists magical healing; a creature trying to magically heal the target must make a Medicine DC 14 check to restore any hit points to the target.

item.name: Amp
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): This liquid intensifier can be added to a drug as a move action no more than 1 round before the drug is taken. Amp increases all numeric effects of a drug by 50%, including any bonuses, penalties, and ability damage inflicted by the drug. Using amp with a drug increases the save DC to avoid becoming addicted to that drug by 2 for 1d4 days; this increase stacks. If a drug combined with amp is not consumed within 1 round, the amp spoils and the drug becomes tainted, as if cut with bunk.

item.name: Dragon’s Blood
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): When added to a potion this herb will add +1 to each die roll of effect Dryad’s Tears Burning this herb will keep lycanthropes at bay for 1d4 rounds

item.name: Bloodgorge
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): When you imbibe this syrupy black serum, your blood thins dramatically and gushes forth from even minor wounds (Vulnerabilty to Slashing). Anytime you take bleed damage, any creatures adjacent to you must succeed at a Constitution save (DC 8 or the amount of bleed damage taken (which ever is higher) or lose their reacation until the start of the affected creature's next round. A dose of bloodgorge lasts for 1 hour.

item.name: Breeam
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): While burning the smoke from this herb will keep lesser undead (2 HD or fewer) at bay for 1d4 rounds

item.name: Blackthorn
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): While burning the smoke of this herb keeps demons at bay in the same way that garlic keeps vampires at bay (1d4 rounds)

item.name: Tamarisk
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): While burning this herb will keep reptilians at bay for 1d4 rounds
